points.blurb: After less than a year at the company, I was promoted from Associate Software Engineer to Software Engineer

items: Architected and spearheaded development of session management system supplementary to OAUTH-2 that allows detection and prevention of software license abuse for hundreds of thousands of daily active users, as well as other session management features
Built spikes as proof-of-concept and transformed them into fully featured services
Designed and implemented efficient large-scale distributed cloud-based software systems
Used infrastructure-as-code tools to manage releases and deployments
Designed and implemented CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps for validating builds, running unit and integration tests, and deploying development, test, and production environments
Designed and implemented monorepo-based version management system to automatically publish individual sub-packages for shared code to company NPM repository based on dependency tree changes
Coordinated within and across engineering teams and management to gather and refine requirements, improve user experience, and decrease operational costs
Maintained, developed upon, and provided support for customer-focused, cloud-based report orchestration system
Wrote CLI scripts to automate pull request creation, validation, and completion
Migrated two projects from single-region AWS architecture to multi-region architecture
Wrote applications in Typescript and C#, and wrote DevOps scripts in bash and Python
Automated manual data analysis processes to save tens of person-hours of work per week
Set up, managed, and used CI/CD tools such as GitLab to use on on-premises server for git repository and automatic deployments of web applications to docker swarm
Developed automotive and home insurance comparative rating system web application for internal use
Developed internal web application for tracking agent commissions across multiple agency locations
Developed process for tracking customer retention, allowing agencies to significantly increase retention
Engineered and fabricated custom components for a helium nanodroplet isolation spectrometer
Designed, built, and coded (in C++) a microcontroller-based failsafe system for delicate scientific instruments
Automated laboratory procedures and data collection
Wrote open-source Python code for subtracting infrared spectra
Designed and implemented infrastructure for remotely controlling laboratory processes via the internet
Co-authored four peer-reviewed scientific publications, two of which I was the first author
Presented research findings at two international conferences, one national conference, and two regional conferences
Trained newer research assistants

points.blurb: I was hired as an intern to audit boxes of equipment picked by warehouse employees, but I automated 80% of my job by developing a Python application to store, analyze, and report on warehouse data
items: Designed and implemented application with GUI for tracking warehouse employee pick accuracy, analyzing daily and historical data, automatically generating detailed PDF reports, and distributing reports via email
Wrote detailed documentation tailored towards non-technical end-users of the application
Provided managers with new employee performance and item supply information gleaned by the application I developed, resulting in a significant increase in accuracy and performance
Minor in Mathematics
3.7 GPA
Designed and implemented web application for uploading raw data and analyzing crop health using multispectral imagery
Designed and implemented data processing system for stitching together thousands of images into a mosaic and elevation map for visualizing changes in crop health over time
Managed client uploads of multi-gigabyte raw data to AWS S3 for automated processing
Designed, built, and programmed IoT pedometer which was able to track step counts with > 95% accuracy and transmit results wirelessly to a paired computer
Designed and developed a lightweight, miniature CI server for self-hosted projects using Node.JS and Express
I plan to re-implement in Python to make installation easier for Raspberry Pi hobbyists
Designed, built, and coded a smart mirror for my partner using a Raspberry Pi
Recently re-worked the project to use my lite-ci package to incorporate CI/CD pipelines
Designed and implemented an open-source simulation of a helium nanodroplet isolation spectrometer for teaching purposes
Re-worked project to utilize distributed architecture, migrating from an ECS-based app to S3/API Gateway/Lambda
Reduced cloud hosting costs from approximately $15 per month to approximately $0.50 per month (97%!)
Wrote Galaga-inspired 2D shooter game in C++ and implemented functional physics system (2019)
Wrote console-based Tic-Tac-Toe game in C++ utilizing the Minimax algorithm (2018)
